460b43e4-7693-471b-8a6f-ff7b131d5c45.description: Badge earners have developed foundational technical skills and intermediate communication skills needed to effectively leverage data science processes to improve decision-making. They are distinguished data-savvy leaders, managers, and/or consultants who understand the challenges facing the industry. They can effectively identify a data science project opportunity, prepare the question to be answered and location of data, and communicate effectively with data science technical experts.
460b43e4-7693-471b-8a6f-ff7b131d5c45.name: Data Science for Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the "Introduction to Data Science Principles" session which provides: a basic overview of data analytic terminology; lays out use cases for Data Science projects; and, explains end-to-end Data Science. The session also covers: unprecedented and rapid increase in the volume and types of data available in the world today; the impacts of this change for business; and, basic analytics terminology and examples of application to business growth and challenges presented.

Complete "Management and Analytics" which covers: the roles and responsibilities of leaders, SME, and data scientists; how to create successful career paths; "People Analytics" defines HR; four gears of data analytics maturity, data analytics leader, team composition and management; analytics leader's playbook, defining a sustainable and resilient analytics agenda, build customer-driven systems analytics; challenges and opportunities of Big Data Analytics; and, how to avoid critical mistakes.

Complete the "Building the Model" session which covers: asking the right question prior to data analysis is critical; designing the right question for a data project; recognizing different types of data that will be important; and, identifying how to use each of them in various business decision-making models (e.g., the difference between strategic and operational decisions). The session will also discuss aggregation vs. isolation and the basics of Machine Learning.

At the end of the four-week course, learners have to develop and present a data analytic project that demonstrates their knowledge of a current issue affecting the industry, identify its business impact, and utilize data sets and analytics to assess the issue. They must defend their model to the professor, learners, and business professionals.

skills.name: Building And Managing A Data-Driven Team

c9759db8-8750-4693-ad6e-6e0b40ccf461.description: Earners of the Women in Technical Leadership badge have learned strategies and tools to demonstrate and communicate their value effectively to stakeholders. They have learned skills in negotiation, conflict management, emotional intelligence, design thinking, change management, and more; all directly and immediately applicable to advancing their career and overcoming the challenges as women in science and technology.
c9759db8-8750-4693-ad6e-6e0b40ccf461.name: Women in Technical Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 3 day in-person program with topics ranging from What it Takes to Lead in Tech, Influencing Organizations & Teams, Leading Organizational & Personal Change, Design Thinking, Negotiation & Conflict Skills in Managing Relationships, and Emotional Intelligence & Bright Spots
Participate in personal coaching sessions with coaches provided through the program
Participants have the option of joining the Women in Technical Leadership learning community upon completion of the program.

8e0e8b68-772d-4943-81df-7df4b19240db.description: Earners of the Power and Influence badge have gained skills to influence teams and situations as a follower, peer, and/or thought leader to drive impact in their organizations. The series enables participants to consider influence in effective decision-making and change within teams while balancing the "big picture" with stakeholders and risks. The session also considers the best ways for participants to make their voices heard, thrive in ambiguity, and understand the value of global networks.
8e0e8b68-772d-4943-81df-7df4b19240db.name: Power and Influence (MetLife)

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a six module program with session topics covering Project Team Challenges, Positive Deviance, Team Decision-Making, Impact of Self-Awareness and Team Conflict on Organizational Decision Making, Influence and Communication, Effective Team processes.

The closing simulation aims to assess and confirm the participants learning and understanding of the program material. The experiential session allows for participant demonstration of new learnings applied to a case or program.

skills.name: Leverage Positive Deviations For Insights And Innovation

4a4956cc-6a41-4b70-ab68-ecf82d0a3786.description: The NC State ERM Fellow designation signifies achievement of an exemplary level of executive education in the field of Enterprise Risk Management, a commitment to ongoing education on current practices in ERM, and membership in a network of ERM professionals who will facilitate sharing of best practices and benchmarking of practices within and across industries.
4a4956cc-6a41-4b70-ab68-ecf82d0a3786.name: ERM Fellow

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 24 CPE credit hours of NC State sponsored events during a 30-month period as follows: Take one (1) Foundation Workshop or any of our ERM Industry specific workshops (Higher Ed, Non-Profits, etc.). Complete the remaining hours with these events: 1. Roundtable Summit (5 hours), 2. Pre- or Post-Roundtable Workshop (4 hours), 3. A second Foundation Workshop (any listed above, 8-12 hours), 4. Other NC State sponsored ERM workshops that may be offered from time to time.
Submit a completed application and upon confirmation of approval, pay a one-time $50 processing fee.

In each calendar year after the year of completion of the initial requirements, ERM Fellows must maintain currency by completing one of the following: 1. Roundtable Summit (5 hours), 2. Pre- or Post-Roundtable Workshop (4 hours), 3. Any other NC State sponsored ERM workshops that offer at least 4 hours of CPE credit.

0d8dfd89-97b4-4674-835e-a95ea8690228.description: Earners of the Innovation Leaders badge have successfully completed a six-day, two-module program on innovation and learned skills for identifying and developing a proposed opportunity for business growth through analytics and enhanced leadership capabilities. As part of the consortium model, participants engaged with peers at other organizations to share and learn best practices in innovation.
0d8dfd89-97b4-4674-835e-a95ea8690228.name: Innovation Leaders

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in Module 1 of the Innovation Leadership Consortium, with session topics covering strategic innovation, market/customer analysis, data science tools for innovators, leading 21st century teams, design thinking and developing a value proposition.

Participants are required to work in teams during the intersession between Module 1 & 2 to gather and analyze data based on a previously identified business opportunity. The team project will require demonstrating skills in effective team formation and teamwork behavior, influencing others in the organization, use of data analytic tools and preparation of a presentation on the business value of the selected approach to the opportunity (plus alternatives considered).

Attend and participate in Module 2 of the Innovation Leadership Consortium, with session topics covering business case workshop, organizational influences on innovation, leading innovation/change, and leadership skills for innovators. This module also includes an optional learning expedition to a local organization with a strong emphasis on innovation.

Participants are required to complete their project in teams after Module 2. Their projects must provide guidance to senior leaders on how the proposed business model would be launched in the organization, potential challenges that could be faced, resources required, and expected benefit.  Presenters are expected to use skills learned in Module 2 to recognize cultural influences, investment decision-making processes, organizational change processes, and awareness of senior leader influences on

0ecceabb-6bdc-447f-a7da-6d7c0e380c25.description: Earners of the PO&T Innovation Leadership Program credential have increased emerging leader skills and abilities to understand and apply strategic, transformational innovation as key leadership competency. Earners have also applied their learning from the program to team innovation projects, presented to senior leadership.
0ecceabb-6bdc-447f-a7da-6d7c0e380c25.name: PO&T Innovation Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners attend a three-day in person module. Session topics include Strategic Analysis, Levels for Driving Change, Organizational/Personal Drivers of Innovation, Design Thinking, and Business Case Workshop.

During the six-week intercession between the two modules, participants work on their team projects in globally diverse teams. Projects are identified by a project sponsor from the PO&T leadership team, and each team has a project mentor and a project coach (a NCSU faculty expert) who support the teams throughout the process.

Attend and participate in a five-day module. This second module includes session topics such as Business Model Development, Leading Change, Leading Complex Teams, Leadership Skills for Project Execution, Strategic Communication, Turning Failure into Success, and Effective Communication Techniques. At the conclusion of this module, teams gave a formal presentation to a panel of senior leaders. Projects ranged from improving manufacturing to corporate re-orgs to global integration.

e88d361b-28a0-407f-a747-654afa098ae9.description: Earners of the Organizational Excellence - II badge have completed a custom-designed program for their organization. Earners of this badge have improved their understanding of decision-making drivers at a senior level and skills needed to influence and lead change. They are better able to manage up/down, manage ambiguous situations, and drive strategic innovation. Program graduates realize their critical role reinforcing organizational values and expectations in those new to the organization.
e88d361b-28a0-407f-a747-654afa098ae9.name: Organizational Excellence - II

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a week long program with session topics covering Barriers to Change, Communication Style Preferences, Leading Strategic Innovation, Ethics, Team Decision Making, Bright Spots, Divergent Thinking, Overcoming Resistance to Change, Managing Personal Change, Managing Organizational Change
Participants are required to complete either a team project or a personal improvement plan that will be implemented during the first 3 months after the program.

64a6cfe1-9f73-4a00-b6af-e133262b4a6f.description: Earners of the Business Essentials badge have successfully completed a two-module program on strategic innovation, customer & financial analysis, business plan design and leadership skills for managing culture and change. By the end of the program, earners have identified a critical need for their organization and have developed a strategic plan for how to address it, with our executive trainers serving as personal consultants.
64a6cfe1-9f73-4a00-b6af-e133262b4a6f.name: Business Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in Module 1 of the Business Essentials program, with session topics covering customer analysis/strategy, finance & operations, influence & consulting, innovation & business planning.

Attend and participate in Module 2 of the Business Essentials program, with session topics covering organizational culture, change management, organizational leadership, and transformational leadership.

939b2f75-9f7b-41a0-be75-d1ae7e91ea46.description: Earners of the Organizational Excellence - I badge have completed a custom-designed program for their organization. The program enhanced their leadership styles and skills in driving innovation and change critical to meet dynamic challenges. Many of the skills focus on improving their ability to quickly adapt teams to new demands. The badge earners have gained deep insight into how they see themselves as leaders, how others view them, and actions they can take to improve their effectiveness.
939b2f75-9f7b-41a0-be75-d1ae7e91ea46.name: Organizational Excellence - I

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a week long program with session topics covering Communication Style Preferences, Generational Differences, Strategic Thinking & Problem Identification/Root Cause Analysis, Decision Making, Bright Spots & Divergent Thinking, Building 3D Teams, Effective Teams & Unconscious Bias, Personal Change.
Participants are required to complete either a team project or a personal improvement plan that will be implemented during the first 3 months after the program.

skills.name: Ability To Read And Influence An Audience

81b04ea9-dd48-4ffd-876c-831c556c3874.description: Earners of the certification developed the skills, behaviors, and mindsets essential for driving data science, analytic and knowledge discovery efforts to identify both standard, novel and truly differentiated solutions and decision making – the latter based on both company and customer needs that drive increased revenue, profitability, and brand reputation.
81b04ea9-dd48-4ffd-876c-831c556c3874.name: Data Science Pro I - III

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of the certification have completed all ten (10) courses delivered by NC State Executive Education. Those courses include: Intro to Python, Data Wrangling with Python, Multivariate Calculus for DS, Elements of Linear Algebra, Exploratory Data Analysis, Intro to Machine Learning Techniques, Statistical Thinking, Intro to Linear Regression, Multivariate Method Clustering and Intro to Time Series Modeling.

Earners must complete a practicum that entails the application of Data Science skills in the development of a problem to be solved and completion of an algorithm that would provide guidance to the solution.

6e755ec7-5cfd-4a76-ad60-f2b6ed6b4263.description: Program participants develop foundational level skills and knowledge of tools used to create data visualizations, as well as storytelling techniques to target audiences. Badge earners can fluently communicate to audiences with appropriate and engaging data visualizations. They develop competencies utilizing visualization packages in R & Python, interactive web-based visualizations, storyboards, and finished presentations.
6e755ec7-5cfd-4a76-ad60-f2b6ed6b4263.name: Data Communicator

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Over the course of 6 weeks, complete 3 “Data Visualization” classes which overview visualization principles, tools, best practices, and how to design effective user experiences. Topics also include how to build visualizations with libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn and Plotly; how to construct interactive visualizations with Shiny and D3.js; and how to apply many of the course topics to build full-fledged visualization-based applications.

Over the course of 6 weeks, complete a “Storytelling” class which overviews data storytelling as a powerful technique for tailoring results to specific user groups (e.g. students, clinicians, patients, or the general public) and presenting them in a way that is easy to interpret and recall. Topics include data integration, domain expertise, intuitive visualization, and narration.  It also provides techniques, common data story types, strategies, and structure.
Visualization Projects: (1) Critique 3 visualizations; (2) Program 4 different visualizations in a Python or R library.
Storytelling Projects: (1) "Big Idea" worksheet; (2) Create a story describing the setting/situation, characters, conflict, and resolution; (3) Storyboard / outline a presentation.

a1554a67-1446-4853-a4b1-62816f19f7c7.description: Earners of the Organizational Excellence - I badge have completed a custom-designed program for their organization. Earners of this badge have improved their ability to set strategy and goals for their unit’s future mission. Badge earners recognize the importance of their role in defining and exemplifying the cultural values of the organization. The program has enhanced their skills to identify and develop future leaders, and empower and coach their development.
a1554a67-1446-4853-a4b1-62816f19f7c7.name: Organizational Excellence - III

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a week long program with session topics covering Understanding the Impact of Your Communication Style, Generational Differences & Similarities, Leading Strategic Innovation, Ethics & Integrity During Change, Decision Making, Managing Organizational Change, Bright Spots & Divergent Thinking, Managing Personal Change
Participants are required to complete a strategic innovation project that will be implemented during the first 3 months after the program.

d3a6a2d3-5078-43d7-ac3d-0b5f25d855f0.description: Badge earners developed foundational and intermediate skills across a range of professional development areas. These individuals learned skills in areas such as leadership development, design thinking, achieving personal change, working with remote teams, research development, instructional design, and many diversity, equity, and inclusion topics. They are able to serve as change agents in their communities to create a more inclusive world.
d3a6a2d3-5078-43d7-ac3d-0b5f25d855f0.name: Poole Pack Development Series

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Participants attended seminars or followed self-study modules on a variety of professional development topics. Individuals were required to attend or view 9 individual sessions as well as participate in a supported reading group over the course of an academic year. The total time investment was at least 25 hours over the course of the year.

86ecc2d7-746d-488b-9e4d-44f718aa80f7.description: Earners have developed foundational skills, behaviors, and mindsets essential for driving data science, analytic and knowledge discovery efforts to identify both standard, novel and differentiated solutions and decision making – the latter based on both market and customer needs. They have been exposed to the underlying theories and learnings to design effective and efficient algorithms and data structures for dealing with huge volumes of complex and noisy data, and real-world applications.
86ecc2d7-746d-488b-9e4d-44f718aa80f7.name: Data Science Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a one-week course which uses state-of-the art pedagogical approaches, including integrated hands-on learning, coaching from NC State faculty and two corporate site visits. Earners worked in teams to complete a Data Science project.

f05da897-ed37-494f-bb3a-88aff1a78c1e.description: Program participants develop foundational Python knowledge and skills to transition and augment existing analytic skillsets. Badge earners can speak with more fluency about Python programming language and syntax, and can communicate more confidently with Data Science professionals about the use of Python to improve analytic outcomes. They can complete data-related tasks by extracting valuable insights from data through slice-and-dicing and filtering regions-of-interest from complex datasets.
f05da897-ed37-494f-bb3a-88aff1a78c1e.name: Python Basics for Analytics

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Over the course of 6 weeks, complete 4 blended learning modules. These modules leverage fixed course content and instructor videos with instructor-led live sessions and applied projects. Learning objectives include: studying Python as object-oriented language; understanding conditionals and iterators; and, developing the skills necessary to index, slice and stride data.

Participants must complete 4 projects, each requiring the use of analytic tools to extract valuable insights from data and apply the knowledge and skills developed in each session. Projects include: (1) Create a WordCloud for given data using Jupyter Notebook (2) Use Python conditionals to filter ROIs 3) Understand applications of preprocessing and looping over data 4) Find Palindromes from data using indexing, slicing, and striding techniques.

632e69dd-4cb7-4804-ba45-31a252cba057.description: Program participants develop skills required for end-to-end Data Science, including the discovery and basics of data modeling, the hidden patterns and complex relationships of predictive models. Badge earners are considered experts in separating robust models that are ready for real-world deployment from those that are biased and/or underperform when challenged with new, future data. They can confidently build and deploy models that are impactful for solving real-world data science challenges.
632e69dd-4cb7-4804-ba45-31a252cba057.name: Predictive Modeling & Analytics

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Over the course of 6 weeks, complete 6 blended learning modules. These modules leverage fixed course content and instructor videos with instructor-led live sessions and applied projects. Together, they provide an overview of the process for developing and completing a data science project by determining which tools to use to solve analytic problems. The class takes a problem-based learning approach to the foundational concepts of data science.

Throughout the course, learners will complete a number of hands-on projects based on real-world data science problems, gaining confidence in navigating analytics tools and automating the end-to-end process of predictive modeling and model deployment. They are also required to complete one final project at course conclusion.

0a48907a-6754-4866-90dc-ee5b5afc6b9b.description: Badge earners have developed an understanding of the foundational taxonomy of Data Science in order to speak with more fluency in data science terminology and communicate more confidently with Data Science professionals about using analytics to improve decision-making. They are competent in the following areas: language and impact of data science; basic probability and statistics concepts; the principles of structured and unstructured data; and, fundamentals of modeling and machine learning.
0a48907a-6754-4866-90dc-ee5b5afc6b9b.name: Data Science Literate

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Over the course of 6 weeks, complete a minimum of 4 of the 6 classes offered: Introduction to Data Science Principles; Introduction to Probability & Statistics; Introduction to Structured & Unstructured Data; Introduction to Modeling & Machine Learning; Data Literacy; and, ROI: The Business Impact of Data Science. The classes are offered as blended learning modules designed to leverage fixed course content and instructor videos with instructor-led live sessions and an applied project.

Complete an “Introduction to Data Science Principles” class, which provides a basic overview of critical descriptions and tasks including analytics taxonomy and methodology, practices that avoid biases, basic tools in data diagnostics (visualization, outliers, missing values, etc.), and types of analytic output (dashboards, algorithms, models, etc). Applied project required for completion.

Complete an “Introduction to Probability & Statistics” class, which provides basic understanding of fundamental statistical processes, including: sample space, counting, independence, Bayes Theorem, probability distributions (binomial, Poisson, normal, and Students T), point estimation and confidence intervals. The course also also provides an understanding of how data science technical processes are important to data analytics. Applied project required for completion.

Complete an “Introduction to Structured & Unstructured Data” class, which offers an intermediate dive into unstructured data. Topics include data wrangling, data organization, databases, the four V’s, SQL and non-SQL based data organization and retrieval, searching, text analysis, natural language, data curation and management, data lifetime. The class explains how to draw insights from analysis of formats such as audio, video, and social media postings. Applied project required for completion.

Complete an “Introduction to Modeling & Machine Learning” class, which overviews the fundamentals of modeling and machine learning. The class introduces supervised classification and regression: linear, logistic, Poisson; Regression model evaluation metrics; and Model validation, evaluation, optimization; and addresses the top mistakes in predictive modeling. Applied project required for completion.

Complete a “Data Literacy” class, which provides a basic overview of Big Data and data analytics used in organizations today, the evolution of data-based decision-making, primary topics and tools of data analytics, explanations and examples for buzzwords like Big Data, Regression, Machine learning, Data Networks, Cloud Computing, Predictive Modeling, and others. Applied project required for completion.

Complete a “ROI: The Business Impact of Data Science” class, which focuses on creating well-defined Data Science questions, identifying Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), defining the project and metrics for evaluating success, and system tools needed to measure project team performance. Applied project required for completion.

3e116193-08da-4e03-b7e4-e411936cf86f.description: The Procurement Leadership program is a one-of-a-kind executive development program designed specifically to provide high-potential procurement leaders with the tools and strategies needed to make dramatic improvements to their organization's procurement practices in the digital age.
3e116193-08da-4e03-b7e4-e411936cf86f.name: SCRC Procurement Leadership Training

issuer.summary: issued by NC State Executive Education

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a week-long program that develops skills and resources to initiate serious change in their organization's procurement practices. Areas of focus include: Leadership in an Era of Uncertainty, Forming Powerful Guiding Coalitions, Developing a Vision and Strategy, Communicating the Vision, Removing Obstacles, Creating Short-Term Wins, Consolidating Gains, and Anchoring Change in the Corporate Culture.

Throughout the week, earners work on a project that addresses a need previously identified and agreed upon by their organization. They develop the project plan through key stages and receive feedback from other participants. At the end of the week, earners pitch their project proposals to senior leaders, who provide candid feedback to help refine the project for execution. After the program, participants return to their organizations with the tools necessary to execute the project successfully.

Leadership Assessment: Participants complete a leadership assessment that provides insights into the practices of the highest performing procurement and supply chain leaders, allowing them to understand how those leaders achieve success and where they (the participants) fit in the spectrum of capabilities those leaders use.

Enterprise Assessment: Participants complete a benchmark analysis of their organization that compares its current supply maturity footprint with industry competitors using the Supply Chain Maturity Model Global 1000 database, developed by the Supply Chain Resource Cooperative at NC State University.

Communications Assessment: Participants complete the Input/Output Processing Template (IOPT) assessment, a fully-validated assessment for individuals and teams that provides an understanding of personal communication styles and preferences. The assessment and subsequent analysis help participants generate actionable insights for improved communication and performance within their organizations.
